resources.string: First you have to add a new Bluetooth device.
There are no Amarino plug-ins installed on your phone. \n\nInstall the AmarinoPlugInBundle to get some events to start with.
This is a plug-in for Amarino 2.0 and not a standalone application. \n\nYou can add this plug-in to Amarino, by selecting \'Add Event\' within Amarino
Pairing request for %s\n\nPull down your status bar to enter the pin.
Given address [%s] is invalid. Must be of form xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx

Amarino 2.0 - A prototyping platform for Android and Arduino 

© 2010 by Bonifaz Kaufmann 

http://www.amarino-toolkit.net


Thanks to Stefano Sanna and Emanuele Di Saverio, since Amarino uses their Android Bluetooth API which can be found at 
http://code.google.com/p/android-bluetooth/

Release Notes 
0.55 
 - fixed bug in MessageBuilder. Flags were converted to numbers in some cases. 
0.53 
 - fixed bug in Amarino API (in Amarino.java), device address was not sent when using sendDataToArduino() function 

0.52 
 - added fall back when UUID does not work, it will try to use the good old port 1 

0.5 
 - uses UUID (instead of always port 1) to determine which port to use when connecting to a Bluetooth module 
 - added release notes dialog to show up when a new Amarino version has been installed 
 - shows a message when no plug-ins are installed and user tries to add an event
